title: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content:
Hi there, I'm new to this forum. Had I known that there's a fan base still going for Commander Keen, I might have found out about this place ages ago! Anyway, here's a little homage to CK that I finished a few days ago (I'm an artist).

[url=http://chemicalalia.deviantart.com/art/Commander-Keen-65676905]chemicalalia.deviantart.com/art/Commander-Keen-65676905[/url]

Hope you like it!

title: Re: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content:
Fuckin A that's good..

Keep up the good work!~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content:
Whoa, comments already! Thanks, guys, I appreciate it! That picture was done all digitally in Photoshop.

title: Re: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content:
Welcome to the Public Commander Keen Forum!

Oooh... another artist on DA... I shall check your gallery.

Oh... after looking in your gallery I made this connection.
[url=http://chemicalalia.deviantart.com/art/Commander-Keen-Koopas-15272080]chemicalalia.deviantart.com/art/Commander-Keen-Koopas-15272080[/url]
I always wondered... What was the inspiration for that bizzare picture?


And Shadow Master... what the hell?-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content: Shiiiiiny. I could go into some minor complaints (like "Hey, that location doesn't exist!" Well, it could be Hillville, maybe), but it looks great. The fire's kind of odd, but I know how difficult good CG fire is to create.

title: Re: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content: In terms of proportion and perspective, it's a mess. Also, Keen looks like a girl, and his helmet is beyond wonky. Otherwise, it's not bad. I really like the background.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: Commander Keen fanart thinger
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]In terms of proportion and perspective, it's a mess. Also, Keen looks like a girl, and his helmet is beyond wonky. Otherwise, it's not bad. I really like the background.[hr][/quote]

Heh, yeah, I know. With a lot of my cartoon illustrations, I tend to follow the northern Renaissance concept of "perspective lolwut???" and just place things wherever I think they look good. My professors would shoot me. I'm also more accustomed to drawing females and rarely do kids, so I'll bet that's where that's coming from.

[quote]Quote:[hr]What was the inspiration for that bizzare picture?[hr][/quote]

Haha, you've seen that before? I run a Mario bros. website, and I like to make some fanart here and there for the galleries, and I was totally out of ideas that day. I have no idea what possessed me to make that.

title: heh
content: I liked the 7 Koopa Kids... so much more potential than that Bowser Jr. crap.

title: Re: heh
content:
Well, I'm glad something did, and whenever you feel the urge to draw more Keen -- don't supress it! (And post it here.)3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
